Posts.Content: Hi I am also new to here! I had a recall after my mammogram... had all the tests but before the biopsies was told, if I wanted, I could here my initials diagnosis. I had a cancerous lump with lots of floating calcium dots! (I’ve googled the names but can’t remember them at the moment ! ) I then went for the biopsies... one of the lump then about 30 (that felt like 100!) in the ‘floaters! I go tomorrow to see the consultant to hear exactly what stage I’m at and what procedures I will have.  It’s all surreal at the moment and I know you will all have been there! Slightly more difficult at the moment as my wonderful step dad has just had a terminal diagnosis I also have fibromyalgia, which robbed me of my dream job,  Deputy Principal, and this is now going to affect my job as a private tutor! However, I’m a fighter, a warrior and I WILL kick my cancer’s butt into another stratosphere!!  Hope everyone here is the best that they can be and I wish everyone success in their treatment   Karen xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed triple negative starting Chemo 1st May

Posts.Content: It's so distressing to hear you have it for a second time! So cruel. Let's pray that after this, you can go on to continue a happy and healthy life. Sending lots of hugs Karen xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed triple negative starting Chemo 1st May
